headline.main: Personal Health: Reaching for Zen With Each Stroke and Lap

docs.abstract: Jane E Brody Personal Health column extolls the extensive benefits of swimming, in light of new Lynn Sherr book Swim: Why We Love the Water. Drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: As far back as I can remember, I have been more at home in water than on land. My father taught me to swim at age 3, and I've been an enthusiast ever since. While most of my aquatic adventures have been relatively tame, a few have been remarkable. I've swum with piranhas in the Amazon, sharks and penguins in the Galápagos, schools of tropical fish off Papua New Guinea, an octopus at the Great Barrier Reef, and sea lions off the coast of Mexico.
